question:
You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure that the code you generate is executable for demonstration purposes.
Please help me implement this SVG image using code. Listen to music with headphones for better sound quality.

checklist.title: Is the SVG image properly constructed with accurate structure?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the SVG code has proper namespace declarations, viewport settings, and dimensioning. Check if the SVG element has width/height attributes or viewBox properly defined. Deduct 5 points if namespace is missing, 3 points for incorrect viewBox, and 2 points for missing responsive attributes. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the headphones accurately depicted in the SVG?
checklist.description: Review whether the SVG correctly implements the headphone shape with appropriate paths, curves, and proportions. Score 3 points for basic shape outline, 5 points for detailed components (ear cups, headband, padding), and 10 points for a complete and accurate representation with proper depth and dimension.

checklist.title: Is the musical element/sound visualization properly implemented?
checklist.description: Assess if the SVG includes visual elements representing music or sound (such as musical notes, sound waves, or visualizations). Check if these elements enhance the context of using headphones for better sound quality. Award 5 points for basic music symbols, 8 points for animated sound elements, and 10 points for comprehensive sound visualization that connects with the headphone concept.

checklist.title: Does the SVG include appropriate animations or interactivity?
checklist.description: Examine if the SVG implements animations (such as pulsing sound waves, moving notes) or interactive elements (volume control, play/pause functionality). Score 3 points for basic CSS animations, 7 points for SMIL animations, and 10 points for sophisticated JavaScript-driven interactive elements that enhance the headphone/music concept.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code handles browser compatibility issues, includes fallbacks for unsupported features, and implements proper error handling for animations or interactions. Code with strong robustness should work across major browsers. Give 10 points if fully robust, 5 points for average robustness, and 0 points if major compatibility issues exist.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Sound visualization that changes with simulated audio intensity 2. User-interactive headphone color customization 3. Responsive design that adapts to different screen sizes). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant path definitions or duplicate elements 2. Unnecessary filters or effects that don't contribute to the headphone/music concept 3. Excessive animations that affect performance. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core visualization is obscured by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular organization (grouped elements, reusable components, clear naming conventions), optimized code (minimal path points, efficient use of SVG elements), and proper commenting. Deduct 5 points if SVG elements lack proper grouping; deduct 5 points if the code is unnecessarily verbose; deduct 5 points if there are no comments explaining complex parts. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG follows professional design principles: 1) Limited, harmonious color palette 2) Proper use of stroke widths and fills 3) Clear visual hierarchy and appropriate use of negative space. Deduct 3 points for jarring color combinations, 5 points for inconsistent styling, and 5 points for poor visual balance. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether any animations or transitions in the SVG are smooth and natural: 1) Animations have appropriate easing 2) Transition durations feel natural (300-500ms) 3) Interactive elements provide clear visual feedback. Deduct 5 points for jerky animations, 3 points for inappropriate timing, and 5 points for confusing interaction states. The full score is 10 points.
